verses.roman:
jayadhvajāt tālajaṅghas
tasya putra-śataṁ tv abhūt
kṣatraṁ yat tālajaṅghākhyam
aurva-tejopasaṁhṛtam

synonyms: jayadhvajāt—of Jayadhvaja; tālajaṅghaḥ—a son named Tālajaṅgha; tasya—of him (Tālajaṅgha); putra-śatam—one hundred sons; tu—indeed; abhūt—were born; kṣatram—a dynasty of kṣatriyas; yat—which; tālajaṅgha-ākhyam—were known as the Tālajaṅghas; aurva-tejaḥ—being very powerful; upasaṁhṛtam—were killed by Mahārāja Sagara.
translation: Jayadhvaja had a son named Tālajaṅgha, who had one hundred sons. All the kṣatriyas in that dynasty, known as Tālajaṅgha, were annihilated by the great power received by Mahārāja Sagara from Aurva Ṛṣi.
